name: Technical Claim Verification
description: Verifies technical and product claims against actual specifications, independent testing, regulatory compliance, and comparative analysis. Based on ProPublica's data-driven verification and FDA/FTC enforcement patterns.

task.purpose: Verify the technical/product claim in "{evidence.description}" against actual specifications. Marketing claims frequently diverge from actual product specs — the gap between claim and reality must be measured.
keyTasks: Find the product's actual specification/ingredient list from official sources (not marketing).
Compare marketing claims against actual specs.
Check for certifications claimed vs. certifications actually held.
Note any discrepancies between claimed and actual specifications.
task.endState: Actual specs located and compared to claims: discrepancies documented, certifications verified or flagged.

task.purpose: Find independent testing and third-party evaluations of the product/technology in "{evidence.description}". Manufacturer claims are inherently biased — independent verification is essential.
keyTasks: Find independent lab tests or third-party evaluations.
Search consumer testing organizations (Consumer Reports, Wirecutter, independent labs).
Check if any regulatory body has tested or evaluated the product.
Compare independent test results to manufacturer claims.
task.endState: Independent testing landscape mapped: lab tests found, consumer testing results collected, regulatory evaluations cataloged.

requiredOutputs.description: Summary of test results vs. claims

task.purpose: Check the regulatory and safety record for the product/technology in "{evidence.description}". Regulatory actions, recalls, and adverse events are high-signal indicators of claim reliability.
keyTasks: Search for FDA warning letters, recalls, safety notices.
Search for FTC enforcement actions (false advertising).
Search for international equivalent actions (EU RAPEX, etc.).
Check adverse event reporting databases (FAERS, CPSC).
task.endState: Regulatory and safety record documented: warning letters, recalls, enforcement actions, and adverse events cataloged or confirmed absent.

task.purpose: Compare the product/technology in "{evidence.description}" against competitors on verified metrics. Comparative context reveals whether claims represent genuine differentiation or marketing hype.
keyTasks: Compare against competing/alternative products on the same verified metrics.
Identify best-in-class products based on independent evidence, not marketing.
Produce actionable ranking if sufficient data exists.
Assess the overall data quality supporting the comparison.
task.endState: Comparative analysis complete: products compared on verified metrics, best-in-class identified, data quality assessed.

requiredOutputs.description: Best-in-class product based on independent evidence
Quality of data supporting the comparison: high, moderate, low
